Mrs. B. plans to use the loan of Rs 25,000 to buy tailoring materials for her business. She wants to use the shop's income to improve her family's standard of living and for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi B. is a tailor in the town of Bhakepati. She opened her tailoring shop three years ago. Her specialty is making custom-fitted ladies dresses like the Kurta Sulwar (a pant and tunic outfit) which are very popular with Nepali women. Before starting her own business, Mrs B. took a six month training course in tailoring from a tailor shop near her locality.

Mrs. B. plans to use the loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring work. She wants to use the shop's income for self-improvement and for her children’s education. In Nepal the cost of a good education is increasing and Mrs. B. is saving her income to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: To buys raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice G. K. is a married woman who lives with her six dependents. She has received no formal education. Her husband is a farmer.

Alice operates a food joint where she cooks fufu (starchy dumpling made from cassava, yam, plantain or rice) and other local dishes for sale at Jukwa. She has been doing this for some time now. Alice uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Alice will add the loan to her initial income to purchase more foodstuffs for her cooking business. With the new earnings from her extended business, Alice plans to save to buy a shop for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs for her cooking business

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S. is divorced and has five dependents. She has received a senior high educational background.

Afia sells fresh tomatoes, garden eggs (eggplant) and maize at Jukwa market and has been doing this for some time now. At the time of visit, she had run out of her stock of maize and was yet to receive some from her supplier.

Afia uses her income to provide meaningful education for her dependents. She will use the loan to purchase more maize to sell since demand is very high. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to reinvest in her business and to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia T. sells fresh groundnuts (peanuts) and sugarcane at Jukwa. In the photo, the sugarcane behind her was bought by one of her customers.

Afia has attained a junior high level of education. She is divorced and has two children. She is responsible for the paying of school fees and utility bills.

Afia’s loan will be used to buy more groundnuts and sugarcane for sale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts and sugarcane to sell

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua P. is happily married and has three children. She has received a junior high educational background.

Akosua sells secondhand clothing (both boys’ and ladies’) at Jukwa, which she has been doing for some time now. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep of the home.

Akosua will use the loan she will be receiving to purchase bales of used clothes to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more bales of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is a single parent living with her three children. She has no formal education.

Afia sells maize at Jukwa and uses the income she gets from her sales to provide shelter, food and clothing for her children.

Afia will use the loan to purchase more maize to sell. With the new profits from her extended business, she plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more maize to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena N. is married and is blessed by God with a child. Abena has received senior high education.

Abena is into a joint venture with her husband. They sell yam and mobile-phone accessories at Jukwa. Her husband is a mobile-phone repairer. She supports her husband in taking care of the family.

Abena has been in joint business with her husband for some time now. Her loan will be added to her main capital to buy more yams for sale since demand for her yams has increased.

Abena hopes to use the new income from her business to save to build a house on an already-purchased piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more yams to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. sells vegetables such as peppers, tomatoes, garden eggs (eggplant) and onions at Jukwa. She has received junior high education. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.

Yaa provides a helping hand to her husband by paying school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy additional vegetables to sell. She hopes to use the new earnings from her business to save to build a house.

loans.use: To buy additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. sells baked bread and eggs at Jukwa. At the time of visit, she had not yet received her consignment from her egg supplier.

Abena has attained a junior high level of education. She is responsible for the general upkeep of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more crates of eggs and bread for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs and bread to sell

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Having two children, Perla O. doesn’t know anymore how she will budget their small income. Her husband works as a farmer and she is helping her husband maintain the rice field. In addition to the rice farm, she also ventures into a piggery business, as well as managing a small sari-sari store to supplement their family income.

Perla is currently preparing her farm for planting and that is why she is needing all the help to be able improve their harvest. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn L. has been married for nineteen years and has three children, the eldest being 19 years old.

Roselyn is a rice grower. The income which she earns from growing rice has helped her family a lot to buy food and other basic needs. Now, she has little problem in financing her rice farm and that is why she needed to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie Q., 34 years old, owns a small rice farm. This helps her buy the things she needs, including what her family will ask for - like food, clothes and other basic necessities. She said that, if she will not work hard in her farm, she won’t get anything for her family.

Now, Vergie is having difficulty in maintaining her 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm because of financial constraints in the family. She would like to apply for a loan of Php 5,000 from Community Economic Ventures, Inc. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm supplies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and farm supplies

loans.name: Moises Edwin

texts.es: EL SR. MOISES ES UN CLIENTE NUEVO QUE FUE RECOMENDADO POR SU MAMA QUE ES CLIENTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION, EL RADICO POR UN TIEMPO EN LA REPUBLICA ARGENTINA Y TRABAJABA CON LO QUE ES CONFECCION DE ROPA, AHORA QUE VOLVIO A SU PAIS EL QUIERE EMPEZAR SU PROPIA EMPRESA AQUÍ SOLAMENTE CUENTA CON UNA MAQUINA EN LA QUE CONFECCIONA CHALECHOS EN TELA POLAR, CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA UNA OJALADORA ES UNA MAQUINA PARA HACER OJALES PARA PONER BOTONES A LA ROPA Y REALIZARA DIFERENTES TIPOS DE PRENDAS, EL TIENE LA INTENCION DE TENER DE AQUI A UNOS 2 AÑOS UNA EMPRESA RELATIVAMENTE GRANDE Y CON MUY BUENA CALIDAD DE PRODUCTOS, EL TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE TRABAJAR Y TRIUNFAR AQUI EN SU PAIS NATAL, ES MUY TRABAJADOR Y TIENE MUCHAS GANAS DE SUPERARSE PARA ASI MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Moses is a new client who was recommended by his mother, who is a client of our institution. He lived in Argentina for a while and worked making clothing. Now that he has returned to the country he wants to start his own business but only has a sewing machine that he uses to make thermal vests. He will use the funds to buy a button-hole machine so that he can attach buttons to the items and make different kinds of clothes. His goal is to have a fairly large, well-known factory in two years making high quality goods. He wants to work hard and succeed here in his native country. He is hard-working and has much desire to succeed thereby improving his family’s quality of life. He is very grateful to Emprender and to Kiva for the trust placed in him by granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a button-hole making machine.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: La sra. Marisol tiene su puesto de venta de tucumanas y rellenos en la calle Indaburo de la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, las tucumanas son empanadas de carne que se acompañan con ají de maní y ensaladas, y los rellenos se hacen de papa aplastada y jigote, también se acompaña con ensaladas. Ella tiene un año y medio en esta actividad, su esposo tiene una movilidad la cual por el momento está en el taller de chapista para su refacción, y por esto está trabajando como chofer asalariado con otra movilidad. Tiene dos niños pequeños que por la mañana se quedan con su cuñada, ya que ambos trabajan, y por la tarde se ocupa de ellos; viven en la casa de su suegros, y son muy trabajadores. El crédito será invertido en la movilidad para pagar el saldo que les falta para recogerla del chapista, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y KIva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Marisal has her food stall selling tucumanas and rellenos on Indaburo street in the central part of the city of La Paz. Tucumanas are meat empanadas that are accompanied by a peanut sauce and salad, and rellenos are made of mashed potato and minced meat, also accompanied by a salad. She has worked in this for a year and a half. Her husband has a vehicle, which is currently in a panel beater shop for refurbishment, so he is working as a salaried driver with another vehicle. She has two young children that her sister-in-law watches during the morning, since they both work. She and her husband care for them in the afternoon. They live in their in-laws home and are hard workers. This loan will be invested in the vehicle to pay their balance and reclaim it from the panel beater. She is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust given by providing this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in vehicle refurbishment

loans.name: Martin Jesus

texts.es: EL SR. MARTIN ES UN JOVEN AL CUAL LE GUSTA MUCHO LA MUSICA ROCK, EL QUEDO HUERFANO DE MUY NIÑO Y FUE CRIADO POR SU MADRINA, A MEDIDA QUE SE HACIA JOVEN EMPEZO A GUSTARLE LA MUSICA ROCK Y MIENTRAS EL CONSEGUIA MUSICA EMPEZO A VER QUE SU GUSTO POR ESTA MUSICA LE LLEVARIA A ABRIR UN NEGOCIO SOBRE LO QUE MAS LE GUSTABA ES AHÍ CUANDO EL EMPIEZA A CONSEGUIR MERCADERIA EN POLERAS, GORRAS, PULSERAS CON TEMAS DE GRUPOS DE ROCK Y ADEMAS EMPEZO A CONSEGUIR VIDEOS MUSICALES EN CONCIERTOS Y OTROS DE VARIOS GRUPOS CONOCIDOS A NIVEL MUNDIAL. ADEMAS EL VENDE JUEGOS DE PLAY STATION 1 2 Y 3 Y JUEGOS PARA PC, A EL LE GUSTARIA QUE LE PROPORCIONARAN VIDEOS DE GRUPOS DE ROCK DE OTROS PAISES DEL MUNDO PARA SEGUIR AUMENTANDO SU COLECCION, SU TRABAJO ES CONSEGUIR LOS VIDEOS Y HACER UNA COPIA EN SU COMPUTADORA Y PONERLO A LA VENTA A PERSONAS QUE LES GUSTA ESTE TIPO DE GENERO MUSICAL. CON EL DINERO DEL CREDITO COMPRARA MERCADERIA AL POR MAYOR DE POLERAS, CDS, GORRAS, ETC. ESTA MUY AGRADECIDO CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Martin is a young man who loves rock music. He became an orphan at a young age and was raised by his godmother. Since he was young, he has liked rock music. As he acquired music, he started to see that, with his love of music, he could open a store. Thus, he started to acquire merchandise such as tee shirts, hats, and bracelets with rock group themes. He also started to get music videos of concerts and rock groups of world fame. He also sells Play Station 1, 2 and 3 games and computer games. He could like to have a greater proportion of videos of rock groups from other countries to augment his collection. His job is to get the videos, make a copy on his computer, and sell it to people who like that type of music. With the money from this loan, he will buy merchandise in bulk: tee shirts, hats, CD’s, etc… He is very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the trust given in granting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Towle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Gladys Lucia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA GLADYS ESTA CASADA Y VIVE EN LA ZONA OBISPO INDABURO, TIENE 3 HIJOS SU ESPOSO ES TECNICO Y AMBOS LOGRARON SALIR ADELANTE A BASE D. ESFUERZO, HOY ELLOS VIVEN COMODAMENTE EN UN DEPARTAMENTO QUE ESTA EN ANTICRETICO Y ESTAN CON EL DESEO D. QUE MAS ADELANTE PUEDAN COMPRAR UNA CASA PROPIA PARA DEJAR A SUS HIJOS, LA SEÑORA TIENE LA PENSION HACE DOS AÑOS Y LA GENTE QUE  ALMUERZA AHÍ DICE QUE LA SEÑORA GLADYS TIENE MUY BUEN SAZON EN SU COMIDA Y PREPARA DELICIOSOS PLATOS ES JOVEN MUY TRABAJADORA QUIERE MEJORAR LA CALIDAD D. VIDA D. TODA SU FAMILIA , ESTA MUY CONTENTA D. TENER UNA TASA KIVA Y MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Gladys is married and lives in the Obispo Indaburo area with her three children and her husband, who works as a technician. Both of them were able to get ahead by making a great effort, and today they live comfortably in a rented apartment. Further down the track they would like to buy their own house to leave to their children. Gladys is a young and very hard working woman who wants to improve the quality of life for all of her family. She started her restaurant two years ago and her customers say that the food she cooks is flavoursome and delicious. Gladys is very happy to have a Kiva loan and is very grateful to Kiva and their field partner Emprender for the trust they have placed in her by approving her loan.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of supplies

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
El señor Javier tiene 38 años está casado con la señora Cecilia y tienen 4 hijos de 12, 9, 7,1, actualmente están pasando muy mal ya que su hijo menor  tiene una enfermedad en los dos ojos (cataratas congénita) lastimosamente la operación no pueden hacerle por que los médicos le dijeron que es muy caro (1000 $us), actualmente ellos no cuentan con esa cantidad apenas les alcanza para comer y para que los hijos puedan ir a la escuela.

Don Javier y su familia viven en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de viloma grande, su principal actividad es el servicio de la construcción y la esposa se dedica a la producción de la leche cruda para su posterior elaboración de queso. Tienen una pequeña casa que solo tiene 2 habitaciones.

El préstamo será destinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, de esta manera incrementara la cantidad de queso para su venta y mejorara el nivel de ingresos.Entre sus metas y sueños lo más importante esta reunir dinero para la operación de su hijo menor que está sufriendo mucho con esa enfermedad , también don Javier quiera construir una casa más grande que tanga una habitación para cada uno de sus hijos ya que la que tienen es muy pequeña.
texts.en:
Javier is 38 years old. He is married to Cecilia and has 4 kids aged 12, 9, 7, and 1. They are going through rough times right now because his youngest child has a disease in both eyes; (congenital cataracts). Sadly, they cant't have the surgery because the doctors told them it is very expensive; ($1,000). At the moment they don't have that kind of money; they only have enough for food and to send the kids to school. Javier and his family live in Cochabamba city in the Viloma Grande area. His main activity is construction and his wife works in the production of raw milk for making cheese. They have a small house with only 2 rooms. The loan will be used to buy a head of dairy cattle. This way, the amount of cheese for sale will increase and so will their income. Among his dreams and goals the most important thing is to save money for his youngest son's surgery who is suffering very much with the disease. Also, Mr. Javier wants to build a bigger house with a room for each of the kids, because the one they have is too small.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a head of dairy cattle

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is married and cooks rice to sell at Jukwa. She has received junior high education. Her husband is a driver.

Yaa has been selling rice for some time now. She supports her husband in paying for their accommodation and water bill. Her loan will be used to buy bags of raw rice and other ingredients to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and other ingredients to cook

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa F. is divorced and has three children. She hasn’t received any form of education.

Adwoa is a seamstress at Jukwa and uses her income to pay her children’s school fees and utility bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fabric and other sewing supplies to aid her in her sewing work.

With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwoa plans to save to educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase more fabric and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana S. sells provisions in Jukwa. Nana has received a junior-high education. She is married and has a child. Nana's loan is going to serve as additional income to buy extra provisions to fill her shop and be able to provide her customers with what they need. She supports her husband in taking care of the home. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to reinvest into back into her business.

loans.use: To buy extra provisions to fill her shop

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana A. is married and has three children. She has been through senior high for her education. Nana sells vegetables, such as tomatoes and onions. She is a fishmonger as well in Jukwa. She sells vegetables in the house but moves from house to house to sell the fish she smokes. Her husband is a mason. 

Nana uses her income to support her husband in the paying of school fees and utility bills. Nana will use the loan that will be given to her to purchase additional vegetables for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Nana plans to save to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional vegetables for sale

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Esta señora se llama Danelia del Socorro D. Varela, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera, ella desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la venta de comida, estuvo un tiempo en el País de Costa Rica, actualmente tiene más ó menos un años de haber regresado, ella tiene siete hijos tres mujeres y cuatro varones, de los cuales dos viven en Costa Rica, los de más viven en nuestro país, ellos ya han formado sus familias.

Con nuestra institución ha obtenido la cantidad de dos con el actual, e igual que este, el crédito anterior lo solicito para el negocio.
texts.en:
Danelia del Socorro D. V.is 60 years old and single. Since she was very young, she has worked selling food. She spent some time in the country of Costa Rica, and she returned a few years ago. She has seven children, three girls and four boys, of whom two live in Costa Rica, and the rest live in our country. They are already grown with their own families. This is her second loan with our institution, and just like the previous one, she is requesting this loan in order to invest in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying chickens and industrial kitchen equipment

loans.name: Asi

texts.en:
Asi K. bakes bread for sale in Jukwa. Asi has not received any form of education. She is married to a driver and stays together with her husband and four children. 

Asi has been baking for about five years now. She supports her husband with the well-being of their children. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of flour and other baking ingredients to supply to her increasing number of customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of flour and other ingredients

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. operates a provisions shop in Jukwa, where she sells bread and other goods. Afia has received a senior high education. She is married and has a child. Her husband is a teacher. With her business, she helps her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Her loan will be used to buy varieties of provisions to fill her shop. She hopes to put some of the resulting profits from her business into savings in order to further her child’s education.

loans.use: To buy varieties of provisions for her shop

loans.name: Luisa Yesika

texts.es: La Sra. S. tiene experiencia en crédito ella tuvo un crédito anterior para sus estudios y prepararse profesionalmente en la elaboración de pasteles y actualmente solicito un crédito para comprar una máquina para elaborar pasteles ya que es profesional en pastelia, y tiene mucha demanda ya que en este pueblo es la única pastelería que hay.
texts.en:
Mrs. S. has loan experience. She had a previous loan for her education and to prepare herself professionally to make cakes. She has currently asked for a loan to buy a machine for making cakes. She is a professional pastry chef, and there is a lot of demand. Hers is the only pastry shop in this town.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a machine for making cakes

loans.name: Rodis Maribel

texts.es:
Rodis es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos menores de edad en la unidad vecinal Ernesto Vilchez, una zona urbano marginal de la ciudad de Ferreñafe, conocida en el norte del país por los platos típicos, se ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace un año tiene instalada en su vivienda una pequeña bodega en la que ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad (arroz, azúcar, aceite), abarrotes, verduras y utiles escolares. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía familiar, junto a su esposo se esfuerzan por salir adelante, el se dedica a la venta ambulante de CD's en la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su negocio goza de buena acogida debido a que ella brinda buen trato a sus clientes y trata siempre de brindarles productos de buena calidad. La demanda por los productos que ofrece en su bodega ha crecido y Rodis siente que ha llegando el momento de ampliarlo, por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de más abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Rodis es una persona bastante trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Sus vecinos y conocidos la consideran una persona responsable y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es brindarle a sus hijos la oportunidad de seguir estudiando para que tengan un futuro prometedor.
texts.en:
Rodis is 33 years old and the mother of a family, who lives with her husband and her 2 minor children in the Ernesto Vilchez neighborhood, a marginal urban zone in Ferreñafe. This city is known in the north for it typical dishes. It is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Since a year ago she has operated a small grocery store from her house, offering her customers all types of products of primary necessity (rice, sugar, oil), and groceries, vegetables, and school supplies. The business is a big help for the family economy. She and her husband, who sells CDs on the streets of Chiclayo, struggle to get ahead. Her business is well received because she treats her customers well and always attempts to offer quality products. Demand for the things she offers in her store has risen and Rodis feels that the moment has come to expand. That's why she is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 New Sols, which she wants to invest in purchasing more groceries and products of prime necessity that will aid her in reaching her objective. Rodis is a very hard working person who is dedicated to her family. Her neighbors and acquaintances consider her responsible and trustworthy. Her greatest wish is to offer her children the opportunity to continue their studies in order to assure a promising future.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRIME PRODUCTS AND GROCERIES TO EXPAND HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Reyna Iris

texts.es: La Sra., Reyna Iris es originaria de una comunidad de el cerro, zona donde hay muchos pinos, ella es preparada en artesanía de pino, se dedica a tejer y elaborar materiales como floreros, canastas, platos, vasos, etc, con tan solo con ojas de pinos y las distrubuye y vende en la zona, en parte del país y hasta el extranjero, ya que llegan turistas y le comprarn gran variedad de artículos artesanos, ella  solicito un crédito para  trasporte y viajar a varios lugares del país y vender sus materiales.
texts.en:
Reyna Iris is from the El Cerro community, which is an area where there are a lot of pine trees. She is trained in making handicrafts from pine. She weaves and makes materials like vases, baskets, plates, and glasses, etc. She only uses the pine needles. She distributes and sells in her region, other parts of the country, and even abroad. Tourists come and buy a great variety of handicrafts. She requested a loan for transportation to travel to various place in the country to sell her wares.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pine materials and tools for her handicrafts

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Doña Maria de edad de 43 años, vive en Villa Reconciliación, madre de cinco hijos, tres de los mayores trabajan, los otros dos estudian, desde hace varios años comenzó con su propio negocio, la venta de ropa, zapatos y cosméticos, el cual lo inicio con dinero proveniente de tres cuartos que alquila que ha sido su fuente de ingreso para apoyar a sus hijos, ya que no cuenta con la ayuda del padre . Difícil pero no imposible salir adelante. Luego comienza a vender ropa interior por docena y así inicio su venta de ropa. Vende productos de Avon, los cuales los ofreces por catálogos a sus clientes, y hacen los pedidos, pero siempre tiene productos en existencias para la demanda de sus clientes. Su objetivo con este financiamiento es invertir en ropa interior, para este verano, cosméticos como las cremas para sol, para piel seca, gel, perfume entre otros. Contenta por que podrá aumentar sus productos el cual espera obtener buenas ganancias. Y poder cubrir sus gastos.
texts.en:
Mrs. María, 43 years old, lives in Villa Reconciliación (Reconciliation Villa) and is the mother of 5 children; 3 of the eldest work, the other 2 are still studying. Some years ago she began her own business, selling clothes, shoes, and cosmetics. She started it with money she earned by renting out 3 rooms. This rent has been the source of income to aid her children, since she can't count on aid from their father. It's difficult but not impossible to get ahead. Later, she began to sell underwear by the dozen and thus, initiated her sale of clothing. She also sells Avon products, which are offered to her customers by catalog and she sends in orders. But she always has some stock on hand to satisfy her customer's demand. Her object with this loan is to invest in summer underwear, cosmetics such as sun lotion, or cream for dry skin, gels, and perfume, among other things. She is content to be able to augment her products, which will lead to good earnings. And to be able to cover her expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SUMMER UNDERWEAR AND COSMETICS TO INCREASE SALES

loans.name: Irenea

texts.es:
La Sra. Irinea C. tiene 48 años D. edad, está casada hace mas D. 12 años, tiene 7 hijos D. los cuales 5 aun dependen económicamente D. ella, a través D. su actividad que se refiere al servicio D. comida, que ofrece a los niños del Colegio Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz, aprovechando los horarios D. descanso D. estos ("El recreo"),  para vender. Esta su actividad la ayudado a lograr que 2 D. sus hijos salgan bachilleres y puedan independizase, además D. proseguir con sus estudios superiores y D. esta manera mejor su calidad D. vida. 

El crédito que solicita la Sra. Irinea le ayudara a incrementar y mejorar su servicio ofreciendo comida no solo en el colegio, también a comensales D. la población lo que incrementara sus ingresos para D. igual manera que sus 2 hijos, los 5 restantes puedan contar con una educación superior.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irinea C. is 48 years old, she has been married for more than 12 years, and has 7 children of which 5 are still her dependants. She sells food to the children of the school Colegio Marcelo Quiroga Santa Cruz during their recess (“el recreo”) schedule. Her business has helped with two of her children graduating from high school, becoming independent, continuing with higher education and improving their quality of life. Mrs. Irinea is requesting the loan to help her increase and improve the business by selling food not only to the school but also to other customers in town; she hopes this will increase her income and like her first 2 children, the remaining 5 can get a higher education.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa D. cooks and sells kenkey (a dish similar to a sourdough dumpling) in Jukwa. She also sells bags of raw maize. Adwoa has no formal educational background. She is married and has three wonderful children. Her husband is a farmer. With her business, she helps her husband in taking good care of their children. 

Her loan will be used to buy extra maize in order to prepare her kenkey for sale. She hopes save some of the new profits from her business to reinvest into her business.

loans.use: To buy extra maizein order to prepare her kenkey for sale

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria es una mujer dedicada al trabajo, de edad de 48 años, desde hace varios años logro poner su propio negocio  una pulpería con ayuda del padre de sus hijos, poco a poco ha logrado ir a aumentando sus ventas, a si como su inventario. Gracias al apoyo que la institución ha dado mediante sus beneficios del financiamiento. Vive junto con sus tres hijos, el mayor ya trabaja, y los dos pequeños estudian, lo cual espera dar lo necesario para que tengan una buena educación ya que yo no logre poder terminar de estudiar por falta de recursos económicos. Con este préstamo invertirá en comprar, lácteos, carne, pollo, productos enlatados, cereales, granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos y una variedad de productos los cuales espera aumenten las ventas en este verano caliente. Ya que muchas veces están muy bajas las venta, aunque no se deja de vender pero las utilidades del margen de ganancias es poco, y los gastos son mucho lo cual desea tener el equilibrio obtenido con esta inversión de productos.
texts.en:
Maria is a 48 year old woman who is very dedicated to her work. Several years ago she set up her own business, a mini-market, with help from the father of her children. She has slowly been increasing sales and her inventory. This is thanks to the institution’s help via the benefits of the loan. She lives with her three children. The oldest one works. The two youngest go to school. She hopes to give them what is needed in order to have a good education. She was not able to finish her education due to scarce resources. She will use this loan to buy dairy products, meat, chicken, canned goods, cereal, basic grains, sweets, soft drinks, juice, and a variety of products that she hopes will increase her sales in this hot summer. Sales are often very low. Even though she does not stop selling, the profit margin is small. Expenses are a lot, and she wants to balance it out with this investment in products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains, dairy products, meat, sweets, soft drinks, juice, and canned goods in order to get a higher margin of profit during this summer season

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua M. sells salted fish, such as salted tilapia and salted octopus, in Jukwa. She carries her wares on her head as she moves from place in search of customers. Though this form of selling is very tedious, she says it works for her. 

Ekua has no educational background and has been selling salted fish for some time now. As a widow, she singlehandedly provides food, clothing, and shelter for herself and children. Her loan will be added to her original income in order to buy more salted fish to sell, as well as to buy fresh fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to put some of the new profits from her business into savings in order to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more salted fish to sell and to buy fresh fish to smoke for sale

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells underwear and cosmetics by moving from one place to another in and around the Jukwa market. Ekua A. is married and has two beautiful children. She has received a junior high education. Her husband is a commercial driver. Ekua uses her income to help her husband with the payment of school fees and utility bills. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase more cosmetics for sale. With the new earnings from her expanded business, Ekua plans to save enough money to eventually buy her own shop and to further educate her growing children.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Bertha tiene 47 años, es soltera ya que por dedicarse a  cuidar a sus padres que  estaban tan enfermos no se llego a casar vive con un joven de 10 años  que le ayuda en el trabajo a cambio de alimentación y educación, pero la señora Bertha es una persona muy solidaria razón por la cual se adopto una niña recién nacida que fue abandonada en el hospital de una provincia, pues la madre la abandono sin piedad y doña Bertha actualmente la cuida con mucho cariño y responsabilidad.

La señora Bertha vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en la localidad de maica, en una pequeña casa que le heredo sus padres, su principal actividad es la producción de la leche cruda actualmente cuenta con 6 cabezas de ganado, ya que anteriormente tenía 12 pero tuvo que vender para la mejora de su casa y de esta manera la niña tenga más comodidad.

Es préstamo será desinado para la compra de una cabeza de ganado lechero, para que de esta manera pueda incrementar su producción de leche.Entre sus sueños y metas es aumentar el nivel de producción de leche para que de esta manera mejore sus ingresos ,y dejarle una buena actividad a la niña y ofrecerle una educación profesional.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha is 47 years old; she is single since she committed herself to take care of her gravely ill parents and never got married; she fosters a 10-year old kid that helps her with the work in exchange of food and an education. Mrs. Bertha is a caring and compassionate person, and she adopted a newborn baby girl that was abandoned in the province’s hospital; the mother abandoned the baby without mercy and Mrs. Bertha is currently taking care of the little girl with much love and dedication. Mrs. Bertha lives in the city of Cochamba, in the town of Maica, in a small house inherited from her parents. Her main activity is the production of raw milk; she now has 6 heads of cattle; she used to have 12 but she had to sell some for house improvements so that the little girl would be more comfortable. The loan will be used to buy one head of dairy cattle so she can increase her milk production. Among her dreams and goals are to further increase her milk production to improve her income, and to leave behind a good business for the little girl and provide her with a professional education.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy one head of dairy cattle

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: La Sra. Teresa se dedica a la venta de joyas al crédito por la zona de Pampahasi lleva tres años con esta actividad, es muy conocida por la zona y los pedidos que tiene son joyas artesanales para señoras de pollera ya que ellas utilizan joyas grandes para su sombrero, el topo para la manta, los anillos y los aretes grandes, tiene unos juegos de joyas completas que son muy bonitos y caros todos bañados en oro, ellos compran hechos y despues los venden en su joyeria, también Es casada, su esposo tiene su movilidad y trabaja como taxi, tiene tres hijos que están en  el colegio. El crédito será invertido en la compra de anillos y aretes, ya que tienen estos pedidos para una fiesta que se lleva cada año por la zona de Pampahasi estas joyas las usan el generalmente para las danzas de la morenada La Morenada o Danza de los Morenos es una danza Folkclorica Boliviana donde los bailarines se disfrazan como negros enmascarados con rasgos prominentes y las cholitas usan estas joyas para adornar sus sonbreros y para sujetar sus mantas, La Sra Teresa esta muy agradecida con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
Señora Teresa is dedicated to the sale of jewelry on credit in the zone of Pampahasi. She has performed this activity for three years. She is very well known in the area and the orders that she fills are for craft jewelry for ladies who wear the traditional clothing, since they use large jewels for their hats, the fastening on their cloaks, rings and large earrings. She has some complete sets of jewels that are very pretty and expensive, all bathed in gold. She buys the jewels and later sellsthem in her jewelry shop. She is also married. Her husband has a vehicle and works as a taxi driver. She has three children that attend school. The loan will be invested in the purchase of rings and earrings, since she has orders for a festival that is held each year in the zone of Pampahasi. The jewels are used traditionally for the dances of the Morenada or Dances of the Dark, which is a folkloric Bolivian dance where the dancers disguise themselves in black adorned with prominent characteristics and the celebrants use these jewels for adorning their hats and to fasten their cloaks. Señora Teresa this very grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence shown her in granting the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy jewels, rings and earrings for resale

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina tiene 45 años de edad, enviudó recientemente y actualmente vive junto a sus tres hijos, de los cuales dos son menores de edad, en su vivienda ubicada en el distrito de Santa Rosa, un distrito cuya economía depende básicamente de la pesca. La zona se encuentra ubicada a 25 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

A raíz de la enfermedad que tuvo su esposo, tuvo que empezar a trabajar hace tres años en el comercio de pescado fresco en el terminal pesquero de la región; ella compra el pescado a las cámaras que llegan al lugar y luego lo vende a los comerciantes que llegan a adquirir el producto para comercializarlo en los principales mercados de la región, esta actividad solo se puede realizar durante las primeras horas de la mañana. Este negocio le ha brindado bastante apoyo durante este tiempo y gracias a el ahora puede responder por su familia.

Martina desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más pescado, ya que durante estos dias en que se avecina la semana santa, el consumo de pescado es masivo. Por este motivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Martina es una mujer bastante trabajadora y que actualmente lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, ella no se deja amilanar por la situación que se encuentra pasando actualmente. Sus vecinos y conocidos la admiran mucho por su determinación, en la fotografía nos muestra las cubetas en la que comercializa su producto.
texts.en:
Martina is 45 years old, she became a widow recently, and she lives with her three children (two of them are minors). Her house is located in the district of Santa Rosa, a district with an economy mainly supported by fishing. This area is located 25 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. Due to her husband’s illness, she started working three years ago in the fresh fish business at the regional fishing terminal; she buys the fish from the boats that arrive at the terminal and then she sells it to the merchants that go to the terminal to buy the fish and then resell it at the main regional markets. This activity can only be done in the early hours of the morning. This business has provided her with a lot of support in these times and thanks to the business she can provide for her family. Martina wishes to expand her business to buy more fish, since Easter is near and fish consumption is massive during this time. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from Edpyme Alternative for 800 Nuevos Soles that will help her reach her objective. Martina is a hard-working woman and she is fighting to get ahead in life with her family; she does not allow herself to be scared of her current situation. Her neighbors and acquaintances admire her for her determination. In the picture, she show us the containers she uses to sell her product.

Translated from Spanish by Carlos Morales, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fresh fish to expand her business

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es:
Luis Alfredo de 20 Años Soltero de Profesión Bachiller en computación del paraje Xerancho de la Aldea Tunayac, municipio de  Momostenango  departamento de  Totonicapán, es una persona responsable que ha trabajado hace mas de 4 años, en diferentes actividades que se organizan dentro de la comunidad, y no han tenido problemas con nadie lo conocen bien en la comunidad  .
Actualmente trabaja en un centro de Internet ubicado en el paraje de Pologuá prestando los servicios a la población en general. Los fines de semana estudia en la universidad
 La persona  necesita ampliar su Capital de Trabajo, por lo que se acerco a las oficinas de la asociación de ASDIR de Pologuá,  para poderles financiar, su actividad económica y así poder mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Luis Alfredo is 20 years old and single. He has his certificate in computer applications from the Xerancho state, Tunayac village, Momostenango municipality, Totonicapán department. He is a responsible person who has worked over four years in different activities that are organized within his community. He has not had any problems with anyone, and he is well known in the community. He currently works in an Internet center, which is located in the Pologuá state. He provides services to the general population. On the week-ends he studies at the university. He needs to increase his working capital. That is why he came to the offices of the ASDIR Association of Pologuá. He wants to be able to get a loan for his economic activity and be able to improve his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: LA SEÑORA MARTHA, EN UNA NUEVA CLIENTE DE NUESTRA INSTITUCION, CON 4 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, VIVE AUN EN LA CASA DE SU PADRE, EN EL MISMO LUGAR SE ENCUENTRA SU RESTAURANT DONDE PREPARA ALMUERZOS TODOS LOS DIAS DE LA SEMANA Y LOS FINES DE SEMANA CON PLATOS ESPECIALES Y TIENE BASTANTE AFLUENCIA DE CLIENTES POR SU DELICIOSA COMIDA Y ANTE LA NECESIDAD DE GARANTIZAR LA HIJIENE Y COMODIDAD DE SUS CLIENTES, SOLICITA EL FINANCIAMIENTO PARA COMPRAR UNA CONSERVADORA DE ALIMENTOS Y DE ESTA MANERA INCREMENTAR SU CLIENTELA Y POR ENDE SUS GANACIAS, ES MUY TRABAJADORA SACA ADELATE A SU FAMILIA SOLA YA QUE ES MADRE SOLTERA, ESTA MUY AGRADECIDA CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
MRS. MARTHA IS A NEW CUSTOMER AT OUR INSTITUTION. SHE HAS 4 SCHOOL-AGED CHILDREN AND STILL LIVES IN HER FATHER’S HOUSE. HER RESTAURANT IS IN THE SAME PLACE. SHE MAKES LUNCHES EVERY DAY OF THE WEEK AND SPECIAL DISHES ON THE WEEKENDS. SHE HAS A GOOD CUSTOMER TURNOUT FOR HER DELICIOUS FOOD. IN ORDER TO GUARANTEE HYGIENE AND FOR CUSTOMER CONVENIENCE, SHE IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING TO PURCHASE A REFRIGERATOR. THIS WAY SHE INCREASES HER CUSTOMERS AND THEREFORE HER EARNINGS. SHE IS A VERY HARD WORKER PROVIDING FOR HER FAMILY BY HERSELF SINCE SHE IS A SINGLE MOTHER. SHE IS VERY THANKFUL TO EMPRENDER AND KIVA FOR THEIR TRUST IN GRANTING THE LOAN.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE A REFRIGERATOR

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: La señora Felipa es una mujer trabajadora,  desde su juventud, de edad de 48 años, con su propio negocio,  venta de tortilla y un molino que son su fuente de ingreso. Junto con su esposo  se esforzaron para tener su propia casa y su  pequeño negocio, pues inicio por no encontrar empleo y con la necesidad de poder apoyar a su familia ya que su esposo trabaja en servicio de seguridad siendo su salario bajo. Es por eso comienza a palmear tortilla el cual se hace de mucha clientela. Y luego pone el molino. Con el crédito anterior logro mejorar las condiciones del techo de su cocina. Contenta por que mediante estos financiamiento se ha beneficiado con las mejora de su casa. Con este préstamo terminara de subir el alto de los cuartos ya que están muy bajos, para mejor privacidad,  pintar, y mejorar el techo de los mismos, comprara materiales de construcción para iniciar la obra,  ante que comience la temporada de lluvia. Sus planes es lograr aumentar las ventas de tortilla ofreciendo sus productos a restaurante, pues entrega en comedores pero desea agrandar más, para mejorar los ingresos y poder cubrir los gastos básicos como personales.
texts.en:
Sra. Felipa is a woman who has been working hard since her youth. She is 48 years old and has her own business. Felipa sells tortillas and operates a grain mill in order to generate income. She and her husband struggled to acquire their own home.

Felipa started her small business because she needed to support her family since her husband receives low wages from his job as a security guard. For this reason, she started making tortillas in order to attract many customers and later acquired a grain mill. With her previous loan, she was able to repair the ceiling above her kitchen. Felipa is happy with these loans because they have helped to improve her house.

With this loan she will finish extending the ceilings of the other rooms since they are very low. This will provide greater privacy. She will also have the rooms painted and the roof above them repaired. Felipa will buy the construction materials so that the work can begin before the rainy season starts. Her plans are to increase her tortilla sales by delivering her products to restaurants and diners. She wants to enlarge her business so that she can improve her earnings to cover both her basic and personal expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish the rooms in her house

loans.name: Mireya Luisa

texts.es:
Mireya es una joven de 35 años de edad, con iniciativa propia, logro tener su pequeño negocio la venta de ropa nueva, como de segunda, cosméticos, zapatos y los que los clientes le encarguen. Su esposo es electricista y gracia a su apoyo comenzó sus ventas. Sus hijos estudian para lograr una buena educación. A su casa le hacen falta muchas mejoras como repellarla, pintarla, poner piso entre otros. No ha invertido aun en su casa para lograr aumentar las ventas y poder captar más clientela para un futuro mejor a su inversión. Con este préstamo lograra comprar ropa de verano, interior para dama, caballero, niños, a si como zapatos y cosmético para lograr las mejoras a sus venta con mercancías nueva. Sus planes a futuro es poder lograr hacer las mejora  a su casa para un bienestar a su familia.


c
texts.en:
Mireya is a young woman who is 35 years of age. Of her own initiative, she established a small business selling new clothing and a second business selling cosmetics and shoes that her customers request. Her husband is an electrician and thanks to his support, she was able to start her sales businesses. Her children are in school in order to obtain a good education. Mireya’s home is need of a several improvements such as plastering, painting, and installation of a floor among other things. She has yet to invest in her home because she needs to increase her sales and attract customers in order to make such improvements in the future.

With this loan she will buy summer clothing and undergarments for women, men, and children. In addition, she will acquire shoes and cosmetics so that she can improve her sales with new merchandise. Her plans for the future are to make improvements to her home for the welfare of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase summer clothing, undergarments, shoes, and cosmetics

loans.name: Lourdes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lourdes  está integrado por  tres personas trabajadoras, independientes y luchadoras. El coordinador es el señor Manuel Antonio S. quien es sastre; según comento él hace cinco años con una pequeña cantidad instalo su taller de costura el cual por medio de los préstamos ha ido creciendo.
Actualmente S. invertirá en telas y materia prima como hilos, agujas, botones y zíper entre otros para cumplir con sus compromisos.

Mientras sus compañeras de grupo María G. y Claudia C. se dedican desde hace años al comercio de avícola donde ellas compra en las granjas las gallinas las cuales venden el mercado.
texts.en:
The Lourdes group is composed of three, hard-working, independent and tenacious people. The group coordinator is Manuel Antonio S., who is a tailor. He stated that he began five years ago investing a small amount to set up his shop, which has grown thanks to the loans. He will use the present loan to buy fabric and raw materials like: thread, needles, buttons, zippers, etc. in order to fill his orders. His fellow group members, María G. and Claudia C., have been chicken merchants for several years. They buy chickens at the farms and resell them in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, among other supplies.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es: La señora Esperanza de edad de 49 años, vive en el barrio Hialeah, su negocio es la venta de ropa, zapatos, chinelas que desde hace varios años  vende para poder ayudar a su familia, ya que su esposo su salario es bajo, el trabaja en servicio de seguridad y es mal pagado. Para doña Esperanza ha sido difícil ya que aun no han logrado terminar su casa. Ya que es toda de zinc y aun de tierra pero tiene la construcción a la mitad ya de concreto que esperan terminarla pronto para lograr tener mejor seguridad contra la delincuencia que asecha en el barrio. Su préstamo lo quiera para comprar ropa que no tiene en existencia, lo cual no le genera entradas, y de sus ganancias paga los gastos basicos, asi como zapatos, colas entre otros encargos que los clientes le hacen. Su anhelo es lograr mejorar su casa y terminarla toda de concreto y poder verla bonita.  Ya que por ser de pocos recursos no lo ha logrado.
texts.en:
Sra. Esperanza is 49 years old and lives in the neighborhood of Hialeah. She has been in the business of selling clothing, shoes, and slippers for several years in order to help her family because her husband’s wages are low. He works as a security guard and is paid poorly. It has been difficult for Doña Esperanza because her house is not yet finished. She already has the zinc and even the land, but the construction of the concrete portion is only halfway completed. Esperanza hopes to have the construction finished so that she can have greater security due to the crime that exists in the neighborhood.

This loan will be used to buy clothing that she does not have in stock. Her earnings will be used to pay for basic expenses and acquire other items, such as shoes and hair accessories that her customers request. Esperanza’s greatest wish is to improve her home by completing all the concrete work so that it looks beautiful. At the moment, she does not have enough resources to make this happen.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing, slippers, and shoes

loans.name: Salinas Group

texts.es:
El grupo S. lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras  una de ellas es la señora Reyna Isabel Roman la cual desde hace tres años vende ropa variada junto con su hermana. Ella invertirá en mercadería adecuada a la temporada de verano.

Sus compañeras de grupo Angélica María C. R. quien vende marisco y Raquel del Socorro S. P.  se dedica al comercio de productos lácteos. Ellas invertirán en sus respectivos negocios para que crezcan
texts.en:
The S. group is composed of three, hard-working women. One of them is Reyna Isabel Roman, who has sold assorted clothing with her sister for the past three years. She will use the funds to buy seasonal summer clothes. Her fellow group members are Angélica María C. R., who sells seafood and Raquel del Socorro S. P., who sells dairy products. They will use the funds to invest in their respective businesses to help them grow.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seasonal clothing.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	
Este cliente se dedica al comercio de compra venta de cerdo y tiene 15 años a dedicarse a esta actividad.
El se encuentra ubicado en Malpaisillo de donde fue petronic 3 cuadra al su ½ cuadra al este.
Con este negocio más la ganadería que tiene ha logrado mejorar económicamente y le ha dado la preparación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client buys and sells pigs. He has 15 years of experience in this activity. He is located in Malpaisillo three blocks south and a half of a block east of where Petronic was. With this business and his livestock, he has been able to improve economically. He has given his children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and butcher pigs

loans.name: Agua Clara Group

texts.es:
El grupo Agua Clara está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Leyla V. Vivas quien tiene una comideria.  Este negocio lo inicio porque muchas personas que llegaban a un billar cerca de su casa buscaban  alimentos de eso le vino la idea de poner una comideria y es  en el 2005 que con unos pequeños ahorros que logra instalarla.

Su compañera de grupo Lisbeth Martínez quien tiene un taller de calzado junto con su esposo. Ella antes criaba y vendía animales y su esposo elaboraba calzado pero decidieron tener un solo negocio es así que instalaron el taller. Mientras Ivania del Carmen Ñamendis G. tiene una pequeña pulpería desde hace cinco años.
texts.en:
The Agua Clara group is composed of three hardworking women. One is Leyda V. Vivas, who has a diner. She started this business because many people who came to a pool hall near her home were looking for food, so she had the idea to open a restaurant. With her small savings, she was able to do this in 2005. Her groupmate Lisbeth Martínez has a shoe store along with her husband. Before, she raised and sold animals and her husband made shoes, but they decided to concentrate on one business and opened the shop. Meanwhile, Ivania del Carmen Ñamendis G. has had a small local store for five years.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as grains, meat, vegetables, and fruit

loans.name: Olinto Valle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Olinto V. está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras de Masaya, Ciudad de las Flores. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Juana Adela Castellón quien vende cosméticos y prendas de oro y plata de manera ambulante. Ella invertirá el préstamo en el negocio de la joyería ya que tiene muchos encargos.  
Sus compañeras de grupo son Liliam Francisca S. quien comercializa cosméticos y Roxana V. G. quien tiene una pulpería. Ellas con crédito piensan mejorar sus negocios con la compra de mayor mercadería.
texts.en:
The Olinto V. group is made up of three, hard-working, enterprising, focused women from Masaya, the City of Flowers. The group coordinator is Juana Adela Castellón, who sells cosmetics and gold and silver items as a peddler. She will use the loan to buy jewelry because she has many pending orders. Her fellow group members are Liliam Francisca Suárez, who sells cosmetics and Roxana V. Gonzáles, who has a grocery store. They will use the funds to improve their businesses by buying more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold and silver items.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente tiene 25 años de imparter clase y se encuentra ubicada en la colegio Maximino Barreto de la comunidad el Sanjon Santo Cristo.
Ella con sacrificio propio mas apollo de su papa a logrado contruir hoy con este crédito piensa hacer la reparación y ha logrado darle la educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This client has been teaching for 25 years. She teaches at the Maximino Barreto School in the Sanjon Santo Cristo community. Through her own sacrifice and help from her father she was able to build. Now, with this loan, she plans on making repairs. She has given her children an education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the roof and buy beams

loans.name: Guardabarranco Group

texts.es:
El grupo Guardabarranco lo conforman tres féminas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras quienes desean algún día ser como las personas que se muestran en los talleres contando historia de éxito y las cuales iniciaron desde abajo.

La coordinadora de el grupo es la señora Marielena Ernestina Gaitán Larios quien vende productos de la Avon, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo. Ella con el préstamo podrá comprar mayor cantidad de productos y obtener mayores ganancias.

Sus compañeras de grupo son María Teresa A.  la cual vende tortillas y
Marlene del Rosario P. V.  tiene una pequeña pulpería. Ellas invertirán en materia prima para sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Guardabarranco Group is comprised of three hard-working, entrepreneurial, and tenacious women. They hope that one day they will be like the people who started at the bottom and are shown in the workshops as success stories. Marielena Ernestina Gaitán Larios is the coordinator of the group. She sells Avon products, a brand known for its catalog sales. She will use the loan to buy a larger quantity of products and to get greater earnings. Her colleagues in the group are María Teresa A., who sells tortillas; and Marlene del Rosario P. Velásquez, who has a small mini-market. They will invest in raw materials for their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Avon products

loans.name: Felicita Veronica

texts.es:
Perfil del Cliente 	Este cliente tiene 25 años de impartir clase y esta ubicada en el colegio Miguel Ángel Ortez. 
Esta señora vive en la comunidad pueblo Redondo de las 4 esquina 100 vrs al este. 
Ella ha logrado construir su cas con créditos obtenido pero con su salario ha logrado darle la preparación academica.
texts.en:
This client has been teaching for 25 years. She teaches at the Miguel Ángel Ortez School. She lives in the Pueblo Redondo community, which is 100 varas (a vara is approximately .8 meter) east of the four corners. With the loans she has received she has built her house. She used her salary for education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster the house and repair the roof

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mercedes está integrado por tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es la señora María Lourdes M. quien inicio hace cinco años con 900 córdobas vendiendo chiverías, gaseosas, helados y fresco.  Actualmente su negocio ha crecido según comento  por medio de los préstamos ya que ha podido surtirla con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos. 

Sus compañeras de grupo son Salís S. Gaitán quien vende ropa desde hace siete años y Marcelina Justina G. vende tortillas, compra cosechas de tamarindo.
Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus respectivos negocios en mercadería para que crezcan y prosperen.
texts.en:
The Mercedes group is composed of three, hard-working people. One of them is María Lourdes Mendoza who, five years ago, invested 900 córdobas to start selling yoghourt snacks, soft-drinks, frozen treats and frozen fruit juices. Currently, her business has grown through the loans because she’s been able to stock it with more variety and quantity of products. Her fellow group members are Salís S. Gaitán, who has sold clothes for the last 7 years, and Marcelina Justina González, who sells tortillas and buys tamarind crops. They will use the funds for merchandise so that their businesses will grow and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, soap, meat, detergent, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Jehova Es Mi Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Jehova es mi Pastor lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, emprendedoras y luchadoras que se dedican al comercio de verduras. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Liseth B. Calero quien hace nueve años empezó vendiendo limones en la actualidad por medio de los prestamos fue surtiendo su puesto con más variedad de frutas y verduras.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Justina del Carmen R. la cual comercializa cebollas, chiltoma, tomates, ajo, achote etc. Y Jamileth de los Santos S. vende verduras como papa, ayote, pipian, chilote, yuca, quequisque…etc.
Ellas invertirán el préstamo en la compra de cosechas en frutas y verduras de temporada.
texts.en:
The Jehova es mi Pastor Group is comprised of three hard-working, entrepreneurial, and tenacious women who sell vegetables. Liseth B. Calero is the coordinator of the group. Nine years ago she started selling lemons. With loans she has now been stocking her stand with a greater variety of fruits and vegetables. Justina del Carmen R. is another member of the group. She sells onions, sweet peppers, garlic, and “achote” (annato, a spice). Jamileth de los Santos S., the other member, sells vegetables like potatoes, pumpkins, chilies, sweet corn, yucca, and “quequisque” (a tuber), etc. They will use the loan to buy seasonal fruits and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La Sra. Elena tiene experiencia en crédito en esta institución ha demostrado capacidad de pago, ella con la ayuda de su hija, han dedicado al comercio, tienen un negocio de venta de ropa que distribuye en la zona y tiene su propio negocio en su casa,, ella está solicitando el crédito para surtir mas el negocio y comprar vitrinas para poner su venta,
texts.en:
Elena has had previous loans through our institution and has demonstrated her ability to repay. She runs a clothing business with the help of her daughter and she sells within her zone and also out of her home. She is requesting this loan in order to be able to offer a greater variety of merchandise and to buy displays to show her items.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Surtir el negocio con mas productos

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es:
El cliente Nelson Francisco A. C.Vive en la Comarca la palma sector la puerta del municipio el sauce departamento león, tiene un hijo a su cargo se dedica principal mente a la actividad ganadería.
El cliente cuanta con una propiedad de 12 MZ propia de terreno, donde la desarrolla para la explotación ganadera. 
El destino del crédito fue para la compra de 4 terneros para el desarrollo. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su finca y mejorar la producción de sus ingresos, para el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson has one son and lives in the “La Palma” region of the “La Puerta” sector of the city of “El Sauce” in the León department. He raises livestock and has developed a portion of land on his property for this use. He will use the money from this loan to buy four plots of land to develop. This will allow him to better maintain his herd and improve his income for his family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land to raise cattle

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce en León, el señor Nelson C. se dedica a la actividad ganadera por medio de la crianza de animales  y por medio de ello obtiene el ingreso para el sustento de su hogar compuesto por su conyuge y su hijo.

Cuanta con una propiedad donde da lugar a la crianza del ganado y la razón por la cual ha solicitado el crédito es para la compra de 4 terneros para el desarrollo respectivo de estos. Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones su finca y mejorar la producción de sus ingresos para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Nelson has one son and lives in the “La Palma” region of the “La Puerta” sector of the city of “El Sauce” in the León department. He raises livestock and has developed a portion of land on his property for this use. He will use the money from this loan to buy four plots of land to develop. This will allow him to better maintain his herd and improve his income for his family’s well being.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase land for raising cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase seeds and tools.

loans.name: Wali Ahmad

texts.en:
The man who is pictured is Wali Ahmad son of S. Mohammad Pacha. He is 30 years old and married. He has a retail shop in Kama district, and he wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the purpose of purchasing the essential materials for his shop such as beverages, sanitary products like shampoo, and soap.  These materials will help him to progress his business, and attract more customers who will be able meet all their needs in the district. This is his only business and he uses its income to supports his family members.

He would like to thank both AFS and Kiva lenders who support people around the world through their effective process.

loans.use: to complete his stocks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: increase his crop yield

loans.name: Insaf

texts.en:
Insaf, who lives in Azoun village next to Qalqilia city, is the mother of one baby girl and runs a poultry farm with her husband. They breed different types of birds such as chicken and doves to sell. She and her husband started building their own house a couple of years ago. Due to a money shortage, the building has been suspended. Since they already have the farm, Insaf thought of taking a loan to improve it and buy a bigger number of poultry to increase the flock and be able to sell to villages around Azoun.  This will help them continue building the house.

Insaf's husband works in a tile and marble factory besides having the farm.  She tells us that Azoun is suffering from a financial crisis and their farm is the only farm in the village.

Insaf and her family appear in the picture above.

loans.use: To improve the farm and buy more poultry to breed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Zuhair

texts.en: Zuhair A. D. is a 37 year old married man from Ramallah. He is currently living with his wife and three children. He is also supporting two other family members. In 2006, he opened a coffee and fast food restaurant since there was a need for this type of business. Now, he hopes that through this loan he will be able to enlarge his business by buying some materials and renovating his restaurant.

loans.use: Restaurant renovation.

loans.name: Tuvshinjargal

texts.en:
Tuvshinjargal is 40 years-old and lives with her two children and mother in Zavhan province, Mongolia in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her two children haven't yet reached school age, and her mother is retired. 

During the day, Tuvshinjargal manufactures wool and bead products in her town. She produces a variety of products for sale including wool hats, shoes, sacks, souvenirs and carpets for her many customers. In addition, she makes wall pictures made of beads. Tuvshinjargal has been operating her business since 2005 and has steadily expanded her business. Originally, her profession was as an accountant and food technologist. Tuvshinjargal has very good communication skills and is focused on the future. She says, “I am working hard to create financial security for my family.” She is requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~ 212 USD) loan to purchase untreated wool for her business.

loans.use: To purchase wool.

loans.name: Dolgorsuren

texts.en:
Dolgorsuren is 40 years-old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent, in a yard which belongs to another person. They have been living together in their current home for twelve years. 

Currently, Dolgorsuren operates a meat trading business at a local trading center called Tavan-Erdene. She has been operating her business since 2000 and has steadily expanded her business and gained much experience as a businesswoman. She plans to expand her business and workplace in the future. The most important thing for her is to be able to provide for her children's education. She says, “I am working hard to be financially available for my two daughters education.” She is requesting a 800,000  tugrug (~ 562 USD) loan to purchase large amounts of meat at a wholesale price to resell at a profit.

loans.use: To purchase a large amount of meat.

loans.name: Gongor

texts.en:
Gongor is 46 years-old and lives with his wife and four children in Zavhan province, Mongolia in an apartment which they own. During the day, Gongor operates a meat trading business in his town. He sells a variety of meat at a local market called Tavan-Erdene. Gongor has been operating his business since 2000 and has steadily expanded his business over the past years. In the future,he plans to purchase a  car with his business profits. 

Gongor is optimistic about the future and hopes to grow his business to a very stable operation. His business is very important for him and he hopes his future earnings will improve his family's quality of life.  He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~  1407 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat at wholesale prices and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase meat.

loans.name: Huderbat

texts.en:
Huderbat is 34 years-old and lives with his wife and children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent called a ger. 

Currently, Huderbat operates a carpentry business in his province. He mainly produces wooden items such as doors, frames, tables and chairs used in ger construction and as traditional ger furniture. Huderbat is very well equipped and operates his business in a workplace which belongs to his uncle who partners with him. He has been operating his business since 2004 and has gained much experience. Huderbat is a very hardworking person who has good communication skills. He says, “I like my work very much. I use to play with wooden toys when I was little child.”  He is requesting a 300,000 tugrugs (~ 225 USD) loan to purchase more timber for his business.

loans.use: To purchase timber.

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en:
Narangerel is 40 years-old and lives with his wife and three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger.  His three children, aged between 10 and 16, attend a local secondary school. They have been living together in their current home for eight years. 

At present, Narangerel operates a meat trading business with his wife in his home town. He sells a variety of meat to his many customers. Narangerel has been operating his business since 2006, and has built his business to a consistent level. Narangerel plans to supply meat to Ulaanbaatar city, the capital city of Mongolia, which will bring more profit and sales revenue to his business. He is a very hardworking person and his business is very important for him. He says,  “I always try to sell healthy and high quality meat to my customers.” He is requesting a 2,500,000 tugrug (~ 1800 USD) loan to purchase more meat for his business.

loans.use: Tp purchase meat.

loans.name: Syvita Group

texts.en: Esmatullah is the group leader of 'Syvita' group. Esmatullah is married and the father of 5 children. He lives in district 2 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his elderly father and mother. He wants to take a loan for his business of general store. He has been involved in this business for more than 4 years and now he wants to buy more foods and some needed tools for his general store and wants to expand and progress his business and help his family. He is very happy with this small loan process in Afghanistan that helps poor people.

loans.use: Buying more foods for his shop

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en:
Narantsetseg is 40 years-old and lives with her son in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her son live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent called a ger. Her son, Munhsaihan is 9 years-old and attends a local secondary school.

At present, Narantsetseg operates a traditional Mongolian clothing manufacturing business in her town. She makes Deel, the traditional Mongolian clothing, with a variety of designs for her many customers. Narantsetseg has been operating her business since 2001, and has gained a great deal of  experience over the past nine years. As her business is the only source of income for her family, she has focused on improving her skills as a sewer and growing her business. The most important thing for her is being able to provide for her son's education. She says, “I would like to bring up my son in a correct way and to be financially available for his education.” She is requesting a 200,000 tugrug (~ 150 USD) loan to purchase more silk and other materials in anticipation for the upcoming university graduations when demand for her products is very high.

loans.use: To purchase more materials.

loans.name: Razia Atiq Group

texts.en: M. Atiq, son of K. G., is the leader of 'Razia Atiq' group. He is 38 years old, married, and the father of 3 children. He lives in district 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a retail shop and has been involved in this business for more than 6 years. Every day he works hard to expand his business, so he has requested a loan to enlarge his shop and buy more food items for his business. He is happy with this loan and he would like to thank lenders who help poor people around the world and in Afghanistan.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Natsagmaa

texts.en: Natsagmaa is 41 years-old and lives with her husband and two children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. Her husband, Jadamba operates a taxi service business and also supports his wife's business if help is needed. Natsagmaa operates a vegetable trading business in her town. She sells a variety of vegetables including potatoes, carrots and rutabagas from her 1,5 hectares of land. Natsagmaa has been operating her business since 2000, and has steadily expanded her business. She gets 15 tons of vegetable per year, and sells them to her many customers. The business is supported by the whole family and they have built a stable operation. Natsagmaa has been planning to plant more uncommon vegetables in the future. She is a very enthusiastic person who has had valuable business experience over the past years. She says, “I am working hard to reach my goal.” Natsagmaa is requesting a 500,000 tugrug (~ 375 USD) loan to purchase uncommon vegetables for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ochirjantsan

texts.en:
Ochirjantsan is 33 years-old and lives with his wife and three children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent on a rental plot of land with a yard. Presently, he operates a shoe repairing business with his wife at a local trading center called Terh. They have been operating  their business since 1998, and have steadily expanded their business and become experienced shoe repairers. Ochirjantsan has a loyal customer base because of his good service and the experience that he has gained in previous years.

In the future, he plans to purchase their own plot of land with a house for his family with his business profits. He is focused on the future and says, “I am working hard to reach my goal.” Ochirjantsan is requesting a 1,200,000 tugrug (~ 875 USD) loan to purchase more materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase  additional inventory.

loans.name: Otgonbileg

texts.en:
Otgonbileg is 41 years-old and lives with her two children in Zavhan province, Mongolia. She lives with her two children in a ger, the Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for six years. Unfortunately, her husband passed away and Otgonbileg has been working hard to improve her family's quality of life. 

At present, she operates a consumer product trading business and also works as a salesperson at another person's counter at a local market called Uliastai. Otgonbileg is a very hardworking person and says, “I am working hard to improve my family's quality of life.”  She is  requesting a 300,000 tugrug (~ 225 USD) loan to purchase more inventory for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory.

loans.name: Hemat Group

texts.en: Tahera is the daughter of B. and the leader of Hemat group. She is 49, married with five children, and lives in District 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. Tahera, the only one currently working in her family, has been involved in weaving carpets for more than one year and now wants to buy some tools that will help her to enlarge her business and expand her clientele to make a better life for her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Sanjsuren

texts.en:
Sanjsuren is 29 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Zavhan province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. They have been living together in their current home for six years. His daughter, Bolor-erdene, is nine years old and attends a local secondary school.
